Witnesses: Robert ace in Welton, Richard the heir, Adam in gardino, Richard vron, John super montem, Richard Campion, Benedict of Drayton. c. 1340–60.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 136 Simon Vitor son of Simon Vitor of Northampton grants in free alms to Daventry the land which Richard Luvel holds from him in Welton, which he had of the gift of John Gemme at a rent of 8/-. The monks are to pay him 12d. a year and the ’hostilarius’ of Daventry is to receive the 8/- a year from Richard Luvel. Witnesses: Sir Walter fitz-Simon, William the knight, John Baiuel, William son of Nigel [] the porter, Roger the porter, William Plumstone. [Torn.] 1230–40.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 29a Robert Lovel of Welton grants to Benedict of Drayton in Welton, John Ossebom of Branteston and ..., the rent which he used to receive from William Ketilburn. Witnesses: ... John Martyn, Henry le Eyr, clerk. 1310–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 262 Richard Golafre of Watteford quit-claims to Benedict of Drayton in Welton and his heirs, right in 1½ acres 1 rood of land once of Richard Vincent in Welton. Given at Daventry. Witnesses: John Malore, John of Tewe, John Martyn, Henry the heir, John Norman of Welton. [Probably a copy made c. 1380–90.] 22 Oct. 1315.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 49 Anastasia relict of Richard Luvell of Welton quit-claims to Benedict de Drayton of Welton all her right in [1 acre] in Welton which the said Benedict had of the gift of Richard Luvell. For this Benedict shall pay 4d. a year. Witnesses: Henry the heir of Welton, John Norman, William of Culdicote, John Benett, Thomas of ... [Given at] Welton. [15th-century copy ?] 27 May 1319.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 61 Richard son of Ralph Godfrey of Northkynelinworth quit-claims to [Benedict] de Drayton of Welton his right in — acres of land and the land called Hokeslonde. Witnesses: [] de Welton, Henry le Eyr of the same, Richard in Gardino, Thomas of Sadington, Richard super montem. [Mutilated.] July 1350–1377.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 137 Richard Drayton of Welton grants to John his son and Agnes his wife 2 cottages lying together with their curtilages in Welton between his cottage and the prior’s tenement. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Mallory, kt., Thomas of Tuwe, Henry the heir (heres), Henry Brokhole, John of Tuwe of Welton. 11 Jan. 1373.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 264 Richard Drayton of Wellton grants to John Attewell of Welton, chaplain, and John son of the said Richard in fee simple, all his lands in Welton and Daventry. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Mallore, kt., Thomas Tewe, Henry le Heyre, John Tewe, Nicholas Gybbe of Welton. 9 April 1379.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 265 John, son of Richard Drayton of Wellton, grants to John Attewell, chaplain, all lands, rents, services and reversions which Richard Drayton held in Wellton and Daventry. Given at Daventry. Witnesses: Thomas Tewe of Wellton, John Tewe of the same, Henry Eyre ... Henry Brokhold of the same, Richard Smyth of the same. 5 Oct. 1382.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 76 Quit-claim for MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 265. Witnesses: Thomas Tewe, Henry le Eyr, John Tewe, Nicholas Gybbs and John Ynglond of Welton. Given at Wellton. 18 Oct. 1382.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 83 John Drayton of Welton and Agnes his wife grant to Simon Tuylo of Welton a messuage in Welton, with curtilage adjacent, between their tenement and the messuage which Thomas Othehulle holds from the prior of Daventry, and a messuage which they had of the gift of Richard Drayton of Welton. Witnesses: John Malory, William Tewe, Henry Brokhole, Richard Smyth, John Falclens, John Warde of Welton. Given at Welton. 30 Sept. 1398.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 268 Richard Taylor, vicar of Fallewesley, appoints John, son of Thomas Slawston of Wellton, his attorney to deliver seisin to the said Thomas Slawston and Joan his wife certain lands in Wellton and Asshebyligger. Given at Wellton. 25 July 1402.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 269 Thomas Wright of Norton quit-claims to Thomas Slawston of Wellton and Joan his wife all right in the lands, rents, and services which were of John and Agnes Drayton. Given at Wellton. Witnesses: John Malory, Henry Brokhole, John Gybbe, John of the Hille, Richard Ynglonde. [Mutilated.] 25 July 1406.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 88 Agnes of Drayton, widow of John of Drayton, quit-claims to Joan Frend and John her son, son of the late Simon Taillour of Welton, all her right in two messuages in Welton. with curtilages adjacent. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Malory, Henry Brokhole, Richard Smyth, John Falcleve, ... Warde, Thomas Hulle. 31 Aug. 1404.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 87 Apparently a grant of similar import. See MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 88. [Fragmentary.]

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 267 Simon Taillour of Welton grants to John Malary, esq., Henry Brokhole, and Richard Smyth of Welton, two cottages with curtilages adjoining in Walton, between John Drayton son of Richard Drayton’s tenement and that of the prior of Daventry. Given at Welton. Witnesses: Richard Ingelond, Thomas atte Hille, John Freend, John Fauclyf, John ...barde. 15 June 1401.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 96a John Malory, Esq., of Welton grants to John Freend of Welton and Joan his wife, two cottages with curtilages in Welton, which John Drayton once gave to Simon Taillour. Given at Welton. Witnesses: Thomas Tuwe, ... Ingelond junior, Henry Ingelond, John o’ the Hille. .. February 1419.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 270 Agnes widow of John Drayton of Wellton, grants to ... Brown, clerk, and William Wright of Drayton, all her lands in Welton except 4½ acres. Given at Drayton. Witnesses: John Malory, Thomas Frend, Henry Brokhole, Richard Smyth, John Gybbes. 30 Jan. 1439.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 62a Henry Eyr of Welton grants to —— Brown, chaplain, of the same, for a certain sum of money, all his goods movable and immovable in a messuage and virgate of land in Welton. Given at Welton. Witnesses: Richard de Hylle, Geoffrey the smith, Richard Martyn, Symon Eyr, Nicholas de Hylle. 30 March 1332.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 89 John Browne clerk, and William Wryght of Daventry grant to Thomas Slawston of Wellton by Daventry and Joan his wife, all those lands, &c., which the grantors had in Wellton. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Malory, Henry Brokhalle, John Gybbs, John of the Hille, Richard Ynglonde. 7 July 1406.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 90 Although Richard Benett of Welton granted to Thomas Slawston of Welton in fee simple a rood of arable land in Welton, late of John of the Hylle’s land, and two swathes of meadow, if the said Richard shall pay 20/- to the said Thomas at the feast of St. Peter ad Vincula, the said grant shall be null and void. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Malory of Welton, John Gybbs, John of the Hylle, Thomas Frend, John Warde. 17 Jan. 1408.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 96b William Baron of Haverborugh quit-claims to Alice daughter of John Slauston late of Welton all her right in those lands, &c., in Welton late of the said John. Given at Daventry. Witnesses: Thomas Tuwe esq., Thomas Fyssher of Daventry, William Brokhole, Richard Ynglond, John Othehulle of Welton. 10 Feb. 1441. Seal.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 271 Robert Cl... of Asshebelegger, Thomas Hynkeley, and John Balches of Berughby demise to John Frende of Welton 2 acres of arable land and one rood of meadow in Welton, viz. ½ acre above Walese, 1 rood above ..., 1 rood above Dedmorewey, 1 rood above Fyveacres of William Catesby’s land, ½ acre in the same shot by the prior’s land. Given at Welton. Witnesses: ... Yngelond, ..., John Warde, John Gybbe, Thomas Othehulle. 8 Oct. 1449.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 105 John Ayleffe, junior, of Asshebylygger and Joan his wife quit-claim to John Frend of the same their right in two acres of arable land, I rood of meadow in Welton. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John
Yngelonde junior, Richard ..., Thomas Othehulle, John Warde, John Gybbe of Welton. 8 Oct. 1449.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 138 Indenture by which William, prior [&c.] of Daventry grants to John Wolf, perpetual vicar of Welton, for life all those lands and tenements in Welton. which ... the prior’s bondman once held in villainage. Rent: 24/-. Given at Daventry. Witnesses: Sir John Malori, kt., Thomas Tewe of Weltone, John Waundel of Daventry [Torn.] 8 Dec. 1377.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 108 Thomas Wolff of Welton grants to Robert Levesham formerly son of Richard Levysham, William Assheby, gentleman, John Horne, gentleman, Thomas Stanbrigge, William Fenall and William Perkyns all the lands in Welton which were of the said Richard Levesham. Witnesses: John Ynglens’ of Welton, Thomas Stafford of the same, Henry Warde of the same, Thomas Spycer of Daventry, Roger Debell of the same. Given at Welton. 12 June 1474.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 116a Robert Levysham son and heir of Richard Levysham and of Alice his wife, daughter and heir of Thomas Slawston late of Welton, grants to Robert Shawe all those lands in Welton which they had of the gift of the said Alice in her widowhood. Given at Welton. Witnesses: John Hylle, John Gybbes, William Warde, Richard Farman, Thomas Brygge. [Mutilated.] 12 Jan. 1481.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 272 Robert Shawe grants to William Catesby, esq., Edmund Newenham, William Staverton, and Henry Gryffythe one messuage, 22½ acres of land, and one swathe in Welton, and appoints Henry Warde his attorney to deliver seisin. Witnesses: ... William Perkyns. 1 April 1483.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 102b Mutilated grant to William Catesby and others of a messuage in Welton near a holding of Daventry. 10 April 23 Ed. IV 1483.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 159b Quit-claim to William Catesbye, esq., of certain land in Welton. [Fragmentary.] ?Hen. VI.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 263 William atte Wodecote quit-claims to Henry ... his estate in a certain land called ’le Torree’. Given at Walton. [Partially effaced.] 40 Ed. III.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 116b Fragment of a charter settling a dispute about lands in Welton, in which William Puref[oy] ..., ... de Tywe, Thomas le Eschirmisur, Thomas de Holtesham, and John Golafre are concerned. Temp. Ed. III.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 79 Part of an enrolment of a decree of the commissary of the bp. of Lincoln in suit by Daventry against John, vicar of Welton, and Richard Falcliff, junior of the same, for burying the daughter of the said Richard in the chapel of Welton ’loco notorie prophano, nullo modo dedicato’. 1391.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 266 Indenture by which Robert, prior, &c., of Daventry demise to Hugh ... and Margaret his wife, a messuage with curtilage adjoining in Welton, for the term of their lives and that of Agnes their daughter. Witnesses: John Wyllughby, Robert Barker, ... [Mutilated and partly illegible.] ... Michaelmas 1440.
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 91 List of names of 39 persons who owe tithe hay in Welton. Sum: 15/5¾. Endorsed with 12 like entries of tithe hay in Norton: 22½d. Sept. 1409–Sept. 1410.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 118 John Coylyn receiver of the rents of the prior of Daventry, &c., of the house of Jesus of Bethlehem (of Shene) has received 13/4 from the prior of Daventry for a portion of the tithes of Welton. March 1481–March 1482.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 139 Robert son of Simon, clerk of Haddon gives to Daventry a rood of land in Haddon, viz. at Cerllewelle between the land of the monks and that of Herbert son of Gamel. Witnesses: Simon de Trop, Simon Campion, Geoffrey Caterich, Robert de Trop, Stephen of Ravenstorp, Richard de Trop, Walter son of Geoffrey. c. 1210–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 3 John de Brochol, vicar of Westhaddon, grants to Daventry in free alms the whole of his tenement in Westhaddon, which he once held of Sir Eustace
de Watford for homage and service. Witnesses: Eustace Golafre of Watford, Richard son of Peter of Holm, Ralph son of Walter, Ralph son of Herbert, Robert the clerk, Stephen le freman, Stephen son of Simon. 1220–30.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 232 Sir Eustace, lord of Watford, kt., grants to Daventry in free alms the whole of a tenement in West Haddon, which John, vicar of West Haddon, sometime held of him. Witnesses: Eustace Golafre of Watford, Richard son of Peter of Holm, Ralph son of William, Ralph son of Herbert, Robert the clerk, Stephen le freman, Stephen son of Simon. c. 1220–30.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lvii Henry son of Gilbert of Norton grants to Daventry and the chapel of S. Mary in free alms 6d. rent in West Haddon, from a messuage lying between the prior of Daventry’s place on the north and that held by Geoffrey son of Susan from the prior on the south. Witnesses: Robert Waut’, William South of Haddon, Thomas South of the same, Richard the clerk of the same, Richard of Holm of the same, John Herberd of the same. c. 1290–1310.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 19 Robert Dolyn of Westhaddon grants to William son of Geoffrey the cook the same 2 roods of land in West Haddon, viz. one over Puttelesculde by the land of John Herberd, and one rood in Colecroft by the land late of Gilbert Mervyn. Witnesses: Robert son of Walter of Westhaddon, John Herberd of the same, Robert Richard of the same, Richard Wauter of the same, Thomas ——of the same, Robert le Warde of the same, John of Stowe. c. 1290–1310.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 23a Margery, widow of Robert Dolyn, quit-claims to the same, her right in a third part of two roods, of her dower in Westhaddon, viz. one over Colecroft by the land of William de Ravenestrop, and the other over le Lonewronge by the land of John Herbert, for a certain sum of money. Witnesses: John Herbert, Richard Walter, William of cotes, John le Freman, John of Stowe. c. 1310–20.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 57b Beatrice Goedlef of West Haddon grants to Geoffrey son of John of Sept. Stowe, a house with a curtilage, near the tenement of Emma her sister. Witnesses: John Freman, John South, Roger Herberd,
Thomas (?) Yves, Robert le Warde, John de Stowe (interlined). Given at West Haddon. 14 Sept. 1321.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 57a Emma daughter of William Godelef of West Haddon claims to Geoffrey son of John of Stowe, her right in a messuage with a garden and croft which fell to her of the inheritance of her brother William in West Haddon. Witnesses: John Herbert of West Haddon, Richard son of Robert, William de Cotes, John le freman, John de Stowe of the same. Given at West Haddon 8 April 1322.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 52 The same quit-claims to Thomas son of Richard Julian of the same, her right in the third part of an enclosed plot of land, with houses, buildings, &c., which Sarah her mother holds in dower in West Haddon. Given at West Haddon. Witnesses: John Herberd, William de Cotene, John de Stowe, Richard Wauter, Robert Richard [all of West Haddon]. 23 April 1322.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 55a The same quit-claims to Geoffrey son of John of Stowe of West Haddon her right in a messuage, curtilage, and croft in West Haddon which would have reverted to her on the death of the said Geoffrey. Given at West Haddon. 2 June 1325.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 58 William son of Geoffrey [] of West Haddon appoints John of Stowe of the same his attorney to deliver seisin to Daventry of 3 acres of land in West Haddon. Given at West Haddon. 17 Aug. 1330.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 62b Thomas Weugh of West Haddon quit-claims to John Hulle of the same, junior, and the heirs of Matilda, widow of the said John, and their assigns his right in ½ the messuage he had of the gift of Richard of Olneye in West Haddon. Witnesses: Thomas of Byfeld, John South, William of Cotes, John le freman, William of Morcote, John of Stowe of West Haddon Given at West Haddon. 3 July 1337.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no. lvi John le Warde of Westhaddone grants to Daventry in free alms, 6d. rent in Westhaddon from a messuage by that of the lord of Weynewyk, to keep a lamp burning at the door of the refectory, at night, from All Saints to the Purification. Given at Daventry. Witnesses: Thomas of Byfelde, John of Braufelde, Walter de Cotone, John of Stowe, Adam le Mortor’ (?) of Daventry 14 Feb. 1341.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 6, no, lviii R. S. of West Haddon grants to Daventry and the chapel of S. Mary 6d. rent from a toft and two strips of land in West Haddon which Robert Hulle once held from him. Given at West Haddon. Witnesses: William de Extone, Walter Wyllam, John Knyth, William Warde, Richard of Olneya, Simon of Daventry, clerk. 6 Feb. 1355.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 94 William Knyght of West Haddon grants to John Knyght his son, of the same, (i) a cottage and curtilage (extending from John Iue’s tenement to the Corncroft) with free entry and exit from the highroad; (ii) 2/4 rent from the tenement of Thomas Knyght his son. Given at West Haddon. Witnesses: John Andrew, William Warde, Thomas Assheby, Robert Simond, Robert Andrew, Thomas Thomas. 2 Feb. 1417.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 95 Condition of a bond in 20 marks from John son of William Knyth of West Haddon, to his brother Thomas, viz. to save harmless his said brother from all services, &c., for the lands, &c., in West Haddon late of William Knyth their father. Witnesses: John Andrew, Robert Ormond, Thomas Asscheby, William Warde, Robert Andrew, Thomas Thomas of West Haddon. After 11 April 1421.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. 140 Matilda, widow of Thomas Smyth of West Haddon, grants to Philip Kirkeby, chaplain of the same, all the lands and tenements in the same which she had of the gift of William Maydewelle of Waldegrave, John Gybworth of West Haddon, and John Sylkoc of the same. Given at West Haddon. Witnesses: John Andrewe, Thomas Assheby, John Ywe, John Sylcoke, Thomas Thomas de West Haddon. 18 Nov. 1423.

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 104b William Dycon of Ravenesthorp, William Lolle of Bukton, and John Thomasse, junior of West Haddon, quit-claims to William Sylcok of West Haddon their right in those 20 acres of land lying in West Haddon which they formerly held jointly of the gift of the said W. Sylcok. Given at West Haddon. Witnesses: Thomas Weilde, John Olney, John Grane, Peter Wyrcet’ Webbe, Richard Moccote. 5 June 1448.

div.head:
Court Rolls, Rentals, and Account Rolls
D. R. 1–18.

div.p: MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 1 One membrane of a late 13th-century extent of the Daventry Priory lands. [Partly illegible.]
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 75 Memorandum of rents appertaining to the office of cellarer of Daventry. [Half illegible.] Temp. Rich. II.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 2 ‘Prioratus de D. de officio celerarii.’ A rental dealing with Daventry, Drayton, Welton, Haddon, Staverton, Norton, Preston, Fawsley, Everdon, Buckby, Thorp by Norton. (2 ms.) c. 1400.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 3 Memoranda of services and rents of the priory [] Hen. VI., 1 and 2 Rich. III, and 1 Hen. VII in Daventry, Drayton, Norton, Welton and Staverton. (Much injured by damp, originally a book about 8″×4″ with paper leaves, and parchment cover formed out of a sheet of music.)
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 7 Terrier of lands in the west, north, and east fields of D. [3 ms.] 15 Cent.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 8 View of Frankpledge of Everdon, held at Daventry. 6, 11, and 13–26 Edward III. [Torn and partly illegible.] (8 ms.)
MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 60 Small fragment of View of Frankpledge of Everdon, held in the priory of Daventry. 10 April 1353.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 4 Rental of Daventry, Welton, (West) Haddon, Staverton, Norton, Preston, Fawsley, Buckby, Everdone. Total £20/2/2. 15 Cent.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 5 Terrier of priory lands in the [?north] field of Daventry. [On paper.] 1483.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 6 Incomplete terrier of the Daventry priory lands. 14 Hen. VII.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 9 View of Frankpledge held at Fawsley. 21 Ed. III.–27 Ed. III. (8 membranes: much of nos. 1 and 2 illegible: no 3 is an estreat roll.)

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 10 Court roll of the Daventry Priory, comprising the View of Frankpledge and the ’parva curia’ at Norton. Dates: 10 Oct. 4 Hen. VI. 4 May 4 Hen. VI. 23 Oct. 5 Hen. VI. 13 May 5 Hen. VI. 24 Oct. 6 Hen. VI. 21 April 6 Hen. VI. 3 Dec. 7 Hen. VI. 23 April 7 Hen. VI.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 11 View of Frankpledge of Everdone held at Daventry, and the ’parva curia’ of Norton held at Daventry. 14 May 16 Ed. IV. 18 Oct. 20 Ed. IV. 21 Oct. 21 Ed. IV. 24 Oct. 22 Ed. IV. (Norton only.) (2 ms., on paper, in one hand throughout.)

MS. Ch. Northants. Daventry 86b Indented statement of the account of the cellarer Thomas de Watford, for the benefit of the new cellarer William Haddone. (It is not a complete account, but merely a statement of certain receipts and outstanding debts at the end of the cellarer’s term of office.) Temp. Hen. IV.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 12 ‘Recepta per priorem in officio celar”, Michaelmas 1404— Michaelmas 1405 (2 ms.) The items include— ’In redditibus £41/17/4¾. … de fructibus ecclesiarum, £81/14/5¾. … de lana nostra et decimali £11/17/5.’ Total £208/5/7½. Total paid out, £291/13/2¼ (including £60 of debt paid off).
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 13 Cellarer’s Account, Michaelmas 1413—Michaelmas 1414. [Torn.] Receipts £312/1/9.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 14 ‘Compotus fratris Willelmi Hadd’ Celerarii prioris de Daventre, de omnibus receptis et expensis in eodem officio [&c.]’ Michaelmas 1429—Annunciation 1430.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 15 ’Compotus domini Thome prioris in officio celar’, pitenc’, earner’, et elemosinar’ anno 1447. Et anno predicti domini prioris primo.’ Receipts £86/4/3.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 16 ’Compotus Thome Knyght prioris prioratus de Daventre a festo sancti Michaelis archangeli anno regni regis Henrici sexti post conquestum xxviimo usque idem festum ex tunc proxime sequens anno dicti domini Regis xxviii, videlicet per unum annum integrum. Et anno dicti prioris primo.’ 1448–49. Total receipts £166/4/3. Payments £196/0/2. [3 ms.]
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 17 View of Account of Thomas Knyght, prior of Daventry, running from March 25, 32 Hen. VI to Michaelmas next. [3 ms.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. D. R. 18 A mutilated and incomplete account roll of the priory (5 ms.). The whole of the ’discharge’ is given but nothing of the ’charge’. Mentions the burial of William Lane, prior, and the installation of his successor, Thomas Ilston. 1482.
MS. Rolls Northants. 5 ’Compotus [1 m.] fratris Jacobi Wittyngton in officio custodis capelle Beate Marie Virginis’ Michaelmas 1508–Michaelmas 1509.
